title: Fix missing gallery images by correcting asset paths and redeploying

requirements.text: Diagnose and fix the blank/missing gallery images on the live site by ensuring the Gallery section references the exact, deployable static asset paths for the 9 uploaded JPEG photos, and that those files are actually present under the frontend public assets directory used by the current code (paths like "/assets/gallery/...jpeg").
acceptanceCriteria: All 9 gallery thumbnails render (no broken/blank images) on the deployed site.
Clicking any gallery item opens the modal with the same image rendered at full size.
No gallery image URLs return 404s in the browser Network tab.
The Gallery section continues to show only the 9 uploaded JPEG photos (no older generated texture images appear).

requirements.text: Harden the Gallery UI so that if any image fails to load, the UI shows a visible fallback state (e.g., a neutral placeholder block with short English text like "Image unavailable") instead of appearing blank, without breaking the existing hover overlay and modal behavior.
acceptanceCriteria: If an image URL is invalid, the grid cell renders a clear fallback placeholder instead of an empty/blank area.
Valid images still render normally with the existing hover overlay and click-to-enlarge dialog behavior unchanged.

requirements.text: Re-run the production build and redeploy after fixing the gallery asset paths so the updated gallery is live and the photos are visible in production.

quotes: Most likely the new photos were uploaded but not actually referenced by the gallery code, or the file paths donâ€™t match what the site expects.

acceptanceCriteria: A new production deployment completes successfully.
After deployment, the live site shows the 9 photos in the Gallery section with no missing images.

constraints: Frontend immutable paths must not be edited: frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.ts, frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.tsx, frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts, frontend/src/main.tsx, frontend/src/components/ui.
Keep all user-facing text in English.
Do not introduce new backend services; backend remains a single Motoko actor.
nonGoals: Do not change the gallery layout (grid density/aspect ratio), categories, or modal design beyond what is necessary to fix visibility and add a fallback.
Do not add or generate new gallery images; only fix referencing/serving of the existing uploaded JPEG photos.
